title: (x) square sans on Wired cover May 2007 - H&FJ Vitesse (custom face) {Andy Clymer}
content:
Is this font also made by HFJ for Wired? Thanks.  
 [Wired headline](http://web.archive.org/web/20111016053333/http:/copperdesign.fi/Wired_font1.jpg)  
 [Wired2](http://web.archive.org/web/20111016053333/http:/copperdesign.fi/Wired_font_2.jpg)  
[Edit]  
If not, what font is this?
author: copper

comments.content: I believe it is custom. It is not Retina, which _is_ HFJ and used for body text.
At least it's not Retina in it's original form, wonder if it could be Retina Display...

Ack, the other day I threw out some older issues of Wired, and out went the one where they introduced the new logo. :-/

Unbeige ran a couple of stories on it a while ago... [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20111016053333/http:/www.mediabistro.com/unbeige/magazines/what_we_dont_know_aboutwireds_redesign_51682.asp) and [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20111016053333/http:/www.mediabistro.com/unbeige/magazines/law_of_optical_volumes_finally_defined_by_wired_and_guess_what_its_kerning_58106.asp). Not a whole lot of info on the name of the custom face, though.

The second article links to [a post on Wired's blog](http://web.archive.org/web/20111016053333/http:/blog.wired.com/underwire/2007/04/the_math_behind.html) that might have more info (I don't have time to read it just now).
The fonts you see in those photos are called Vitesse (both Sans and Serif), custom from H&FJ.
